newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent quiet ahead of fuel oil futures launch.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent quiet ahead of fuel oil futures launch.

text.p: SIMEX Brent crude was quiet in early trading on Tuesday as most players were attending the relaunch of the revised fuel oil futures contract this afternoon, brokers said.
June was quoted at $18.30/$18.40 per barrel, straddling London's closing of $18.34. July was indicated at $18.35/$18.57, also within range of London's $18.43-close.
The market remained jittery over Iraqi helicopters breaking a 'no-fly' zone imposed by the U.S. and other Western powers to pick Moslem pilgrims from the Saudi border.
The White House urged Iraq to reconsider its decision and said it would "respond appropriately". Brokers said this could threaten the country's oil-for-food accord with the United Nations.

But NYMEX crude shaved off two cents on the after-hours ACCESS system from its official close to last trade at $20.36, as players rolled over their positions ahead of May's expiry on Tuesday. June gained one cent to last trade at $20.08.
